intro: Saxifraga bronchialis f. togakushensis, commonly known as the Togakushi saxifrage, is a rare and endemic plant species found primarily in Japan. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive foliage. The plant typically thrives in shaded, moist environments, often in rocky or mountainous regions. Its leaves are usually succulent, with a waxy coating that helps retain moisture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
